name: Super Brick Attack
description:
Entry for the Curious Game Jam 2020

THEME

70s-90s Arcade Games

DESCRIPTION OF MY ENTRY

To meet the theme, I combined the arcade game play of Breakout (created by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak in a fun bit of trivia) with a bit of Level 1-1 of Super Mario Bros for the NES.  

CONTROLS

Use the Right/Left arrows or A/D keys to move the paddle back and forth to hit the ball in order to remove all the colored clouds. The ball will bounce off the ground, but will destroy the ground block while doing so. If the ball falls below the ground, you lose a life. See if you can get enough points to make the high score leaderboard - a true staple of the arcade! Obtain a mushroom to double the size of your paddle. Hit enemies to score bonus points.

CREDITS

Mario-style blocks from Cube World - Proto Series  https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/cube-world-proto-series-14..

Enemies from KUBIKOS - Cube Monsters  https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/characters/creatures/kubikos-cube-monst...

Mario-style font obtained from https://www.dafont.com/super-mario-bros.font

VERSION LOG

v1.0 - Initial build

v1.1 - Added enemies and power-ups

v1.11 - Minor bug fixes to prevent high score popup, power-up paddle location issue, and never-ending enemies getting trapped on the level. (Will upload after voting ends.)

KNOWN BUG LIST

- The high score notification pops up before the game ends

- The paddle, when powered-up size, clips behind the pyramids

- Enemies just keep spawning even if they get trapped by the level design after the player's actions. The player can either "collect" them or they will get removed upon player losing the ball

- Occasionally the ball will get stuck in an endless back and forth pattern. At the moment, there is no bug fix designed for that situation.
